main.sprites.blocks

Class StarBrick

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.sprites.Sprite
      • main.sprites.blocks.StarBrick
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StageBlock

    public class StarBrick
extends Sprite
implements StageBlock
    Name: Jaskaranbir Dhillon
    Date: Thursday, April 22, 2016
    Class Description:

    Class defining the StarBlock (which generates Immunity Star in game). Associated Class: ImmunityStar

    • Constructor Detail

      • StarBrick

        public StarBrick(Mario mario,
                 int stageZone,
                 javafx.scene.Group parent,
                 float xPos,
                 float yPos,
                 float xVel,
                 float yVel,
                 javafx.scene.image.Image[] brickSprite,
                 javafx.scene.image.Image... starSprites)
        Constructs a single Star Brick (brick which generates ImmunityStar).
        Parameters:
        mario - The player (Mario).
        stageZone - Stage zone in which the brick resides. See class StageFloorBase.
        parent - The parent which contains the brick.
        xPos - The x-Position of brick.
        yPos - The y-Position of brick.
        xVel - The xVel of Star.
        yVel - The yVel of Star.
        brickSprite - Array having images for brick states (first element being default brick state and second element being brick state after player has collided).
        starSprites - The sprites for star animation effects.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update()
        Brick Logic. Executed by GameLoop class.
        Specified by:
        update in interface StageBlock
        Specified by:
        update in class Sprite

      • collide

        public void collide()
        This marks that player has collided with tile. The brick logic will not be run unless this condition is satisfied.
        Specified by:
        collide in interface StageBlock

      • getZone

        public int getZone()
        Used to check if the brick should be included in collision detection loop. The zone must match the zone in which player resides for inclusion in collision detection.
        Specified by:
        getZone in interface StageBlock
        Returns:
        The stage zone in which Star Brick resides. Please see class StageFloorBase for details on zones.
